definition: to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
to do/to manage/to handle/to go about/to run/to set up/to deal with

sentences.english: My work for the paper has brought about a desirable situation in my everyday affairs.
sentences.chinese: 參與辦報的工作給我的日常生活帶來了好的變化。

sentences.english: It's got more than a century experience and prestige .
sentences.chinese: 它有一個世紀左右有辦報經驗和威望。

sentences.english: Registration starts today for daiwan's national assembly .
sentences.chinese: 今阿日國民大會開始辦報到耶手續。

sentences.english: We must not run a newspaper behind closed doors.
Newspaper school refers to the different type of ideology and style in running a newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 報紙流派是指辦報思想與辦報風格的不同類型。

sentences.english: Newspaper school refers to the different type of ideology and style in running a newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 報紙流派是指辦報思想與辦報風格的不同類型。

sentences.english: And what is the relationship between running newspaper by politicians and entrepreneur management?
sentences.chinese: “政治家辦報”與“企業家經營”有何關係？

definition: principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
forged book/book of dubious authenticity/misattributed book/Apocrypha
see 念念不忘[nian4 nian4 bu4 wang4]
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
